triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: The paper implements a swarm-based approach for coordinating multiple underwater robots.

triples.name: Swarm intelligence
triples.relevance: The collective self-organization behavior is based on swarm intelligence principles where simple local rules create complex group behaviors.

triples.name: Self-organization
triples.relevance: Self-organization is the core mechanism enabling the swarm to coordinate without centralized control.

triples.name: Collective animal behavior
triples.relevance: The fish-inspired coordination mimics natural collective animal behavior patterns found in nature.

triples.name: Vision-guided robot systems
triples.relevance: The implicit vision-based coordination uses camera sensors to enable robots to perceive and coordinate with nearby swarm members.

triples.name: Underwater robotics
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the challenge of operating coordinated robot swarms in underwater environments.

triples.name: Blueswarm
triples.relevance: Blueswarm is the novel 3D underwater robot swarm system that uses implicit vision-based coordination for collective behavior.
